oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Challenge Model for Escherichia coli in the Colostrum Deprived Calf
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hunt, Louis D.
Hunt, Elaine
Anderson, Kevin L.
Ibanes, Joelle
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: neonate
immunoglobulin
probiotic
immunosupplements
colostrum
colisepticemia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is an increasing number of oral immunoglobulin and probiotic preparations commercially available for the bovine neonate. Advertisements for calf immunosupplements may be vague, confusing, or even misleading. Early ingestion of high quality colostrum provides the best defense against calf colisepticemia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 171-172
